citation.article-title: Salinivibrio proteolyticus sp. nov., a moderately halophilic and proteolytic species from a hypersaline lake in Iran.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salinivibrio proteolyticus sp. nov.
Salinivibrio proteolyticus (pro.te.o.ly′ti.cus. N.L. masc. adj. proteolyticus proteolytic).
Cells are Gram-negative, short, curved rods, 0.5–0.6×1.0–2.3 μm.
Highly motile by one polar flagellum.
Facultative anaerobe.
Endospores are not formed.
Colonies are round with entire edges, smooth, slightly convex and creamy white in colour.
Growth occurs in media containing 1.0–17.0 % (w/v) NaCl; 5 % (w/v) is optimal for growth.
No growth occurs in the absence of NaCl.
The pH range for growth is 5.0–9.5 (optimum at pH 8.0–8.5).
Growth occurs at 10.0–45.0 °C (optimum at 32–35 °C).

Catalase, oxidase, H2S production, arginine dihydrolase and Voges–Proskauer tests are positive, but indole, lysine and ornithine decarboxylase, β-galactosidase, urease and methyl red tests are negative.
Casein, DNA, gelatin and starch are hydrolysed, whereas aesculin and Tween 80 are not.
Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, inositol, d-lactose, maltose, d-mannose, trehalose and d-xylose, but not from l-arabinose or sucrose.
Nitrate is not reduced.

Utilizes acetate, dextrin, d-fructose, glycerol, d-glucose, dl-lactate, d-mannitol, maltose, trehalose and starch as sole carbon and energy sources, but not aesculin, citrate, d-galactose, inositol, d-lactose, d-mannose, salicin, sucrose or d-xylose.
l-Asparagine, l-glycine, l-ornithine, l-proline and yeast extract are utilized as sole nitrogen and energy sources, but l-arginine, l-phenylalanine and urea are not used.

Susceptible to carbenicillin (100 μg), chloramphenicol (30 μg), cotrimoxazole (25 μg), nitrofurantoin (300 μg), polymyxin B (100 U), rifampicin (5 μg) and tetracycline (30 μg); resistant to amoxicillin (30 μg), bacitracin (10 U), cephoxitin (30 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), penicillin G (10 U), streptomycin (10 μg) and tobramycin (10 μg).
The major respiratory lipoquinone is Q-8.
The major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0.
The type strain is AF-2004T (=DSM 19052T =CIP 109598T), isolated from Bakhtegan Lake, a hypersaline lake with 17 % (w/v) total salt located in southern Iran.
The DNA G+C content of strain AF-2004T is 49.5 mol%.
